Module MathUtils
Package mathUtils.linear

Class Point

java.lang.Object
mathUtils.linear.Point
Direct Known Subclasses:
Vector
public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a mathematical point in 3D space. Actions, like rotating and scaling, are already integrated in this class. To represent a point in 2D space, simply set the z-coordinate to 0.
Since:
18.05.2020

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Point()
    Constructs a point and sets it at the origin (0, 0, 0)
    Point​(double x, double y, double z)
    Constructs a point and sets it at the desired coordinates.
    Point​(Point p)
    Constructs a point and copies the coordinates of another point.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    double angleBetween​(Point p1, Point p2)
    Forms a triangle ABC, where this point is C.
    double distanceTo​(double x, double y, double z)
    Calculates the distance from this point to the given coordinates (x, y, z) by using the length rule, better known as the pythagorean theorem.
    double distanceTo​(Point p)
    Calculates the distance from this point to the given point by using the length rule, better known as the pythagorean theorem.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
    Evaluates whether or not this object is equal to the given object.

    Retrieves this point's x-coordinate

    Retrieves this point's y-coordinate
    double getZ()
    Retrieves this point's z-coordinate
    void rotate​(double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
    Rotates this point around the origin (0, 0, 0) by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    void rotate​(double x, double y, double z, double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
    Rotates this point around the input coordinates (x, y, z) by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    void rotate​(Point p, double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
    Rotates this point around the given point by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    void scale​(double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
    Scales this point from the origin (0, 0, 0) by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    void scale​(double x, double y, double z, double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
    Scales this point by using the given coordinates (x, y, z) as origin and by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    void scale​(Point p, double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
    Scales this point by using the given point as origin and by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
    Matrix toMatrix()
    Creates an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix (a 3x1 matrix) with this point's coordinates.
    Point toPoint()
    Creates an instance of mathUtils.linear.Point with this point's coordinates.
    Vector toVector()
    Creates an instance of mathUtils.linear.Vector with this point's coordinates.

    void translate​(Point p)

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double x, double y, double z, double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
      Rotates this point around the input coordinates (x, y, z) by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix. First, this point is translated to the desired coordinates, rotated according to the given values, and then translated back.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to rotate around
      y - The y-coordinate to rotate around
      z - The z-coordinate to rotate around
      alpha - Rotation around the x-axis (in degrees)
      beta - Rotation around the y-axis (in degrees)
      gamma - Rotation around the z-axis (in degrees)

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(Point p, double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
      Rotates this point around the given point by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix. First, this point is translated to the desired point, rotated according to the given values, and then translated back.
      Parameters:
      p - The point to rotate around
      alpha - Rotation around the x-axis (in degrees)
      beta - Rotation around the y-axis (in degrees)
      gamma - Rotation around the z-axis (in degrees)

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
      Rotates this point around the origin (0, 0, 0) by utilizing a rotation matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix.
      Parameters:
      alpha - Rotation around the x-axis (in degrees)
      beta - Rotation around the y-axis (in degrees)
      gamma - Rotation around the z-axis (in degrees)

    • scale

      public void scale​(double x, double y, double z, double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
      Scales this point by using the given coordinates (x, y, z) as origin and by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix. It works the same way the rotation does.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to scale from
      y - The y-coordinate to scale from
      z - The z-coordinate to scale from
      scaleX - The scalar along the x-axis
      scaleY - The scalar along the y-axis
      scaleZ - The scalar along the z-axis

    • scale

      public void scale​(Point p, double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
      Scales this point by using the given point as origin and by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix. It works the same way the rotation does.
      Parameters:
      p - The point to scale from
      scaleX - The scalar along the x-axis
      scaleY - The scalar along the y-axis
      scaleZ - The scalar along the z-axis

    • scale

      public void scale​(double scaleX, double scaleY, double scaleZ)
      Scales this point from the origin (0, 0, 0) by using a scaling matrix, an instance of mathUtils.linear.Matrix. It works the same way the rotation does.
      Parameters:
      scaleX - The scalar along the x-axis
      scaleY - The scalar along the y-axis
      scaleZ - The scalar along the z-axis

    • distanceTo

      public double distanceTo​(double x, double y, double z)
      Calculates the distance from this point to the given coordinates (x, y, z) by using the length rule, better known as the pythagorean theorem.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      z - The z-coordinate
      Returns:
      The distance to the given coordinates in double precision.

    • distanceTo

      public double distanceTo​(Point p)
      Calculates the distance from this point to the given point by using the length rule, better known as the pythagorean theorem.
      Parameters:
      p - The point whose distance should be calculated
      Returns:
      The distance to the given coordinates in double precision.

    • angleBetween

      public double angleBetween​(Point p1, Point p2)
      Forms a triangle ABC, where this point is C. Calculates the angle between AC and BC, or, the angle at C by using the law of cosines.
      Parameters:
      p1 - Point A
      p2 - Point B
      Returns:
      The angle between the points (in degrees)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Evaluates whether or not this object is equal to the given object. Here, if the given object is an instance of Point, returns only true if all of the x, y, z coordinates are equal. Otherwise, returns false.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to evaluate
      Returns:
      Whether or not the given object is equal to this one
